app.Check your BMI results to know how to st: Check your BMI results to know how to stay healthy.
app.Body Mass Index is a measure: Body Mass Index (BMR) is a measure for indicating nutritional status in adults. It is defined as a person’s weight in kilograms divided by the square of the person’s height in meters (kg/m2).
app.Determine the degree: Determine the degree of obesity - Slimness - normal weight - overweight - obesity (1) - obesity (2).
app.Basal Metabolic Rate: Basal Metabolic Rate (BMR) is the amount of energy expended while at rest in a neutrally temperate environment, in the post-absorptive state (meaning that the digestive system is inactive, which requires about twelve hours of fasting).
app.Daily water intake: Daily water intake: Water is essential for metabolism, substrate transport across membranes, cellular homeostasis, temperature regulation, and circulatory function. 30 ml/1 kg of body weight is recommended. The daily water intake is 2.5 liters for men and 2 liters for women.
app.Total Energy expenditure refers to the a: Total Energy expenditure refers to the amount of energy an individual uses to maintain essential body functions (respiration, circulation, digestion) adding to the Daily physical activity.
app.Calorie: Average Daily Calories Needed t: Calorie: Average Daily Calories Needed to Lose Weight Or Gain Weight
app.Join our premium online coaching package: Join our premium online coaching packages today to find the best programs for your needs and save more.
